thread.title: ASU hockey set to open season against U of A
thread.title_full: ASU hockey set to open season against U of A

title: ASU hockey set to open season against U of A
text:
ASU hockey set to open season against U of A Arizona State will begin its first season as a NCAA program on Saturday. Post to Facebook ASU hockey set to open season against U of A Arizona State will begin its first season as a NCAA program on Saturday.   12news.com: http://12ne.ws/1L8SwTR   Join the Conversation To   ASU hockey set to open season against U of A Robby Baker , 12 Sports 9:38 a.m. MST October 2, 2015 Arizona State will begin its first season as a NCAA program on Saturday. Nov 28, 2014; Tucson, AZ, USA; Arizona State Sun Devils mascot Sparky and Arizona Wildcats mascot Wilbur wrestle during the second half at Arizona Stadium. (Photo: Matt Kartozian-USA TODAY Sports) CONNECT 4 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
The Arizona State Sun Devils and University of Arizona Wildcats are familiar foes on the ice. 
This year's edition of the rivalry will be a bit different though, as ASU will be a NCAA team. 
The Sun Devils will begin their first season as a NCAA program by playing their in-state rival at Gila River Arena Saturday night. 
The Wildcats are members of the ACHA, and haven't fared well against ASU in recent memory. 
The Sun Devils have won 47 of the last 48 matchups, but that doesn't mean the games haven't been competitive. It's all the intensity you'd expect from the rivalry, just on the ice. 
ASU head coach Greg Powers said in a statement he knows how special this rivalry is, even with is team elevating their status, "We will always respect the rivalry between the two Universities, and we're not going into this just because they're not an NCAA team any other way. We're going into this with what we think is our very best team this Saturday." 
Matchup fun facts: Saturday will be the first NCAA hockey game played in the state of Arizona since 1985, when Northern Arizona had a NCAA team. There are eight Sun Devils that have NCAA-level playing experience. ASU head coach Greg Powers is 39-1 all-time against Arizona. Jordan Young, Liam Norris and Garrett Peterson will all take the ice as ASU captains for the first time this Saturday. 
Hockey fans would be doing themselves a disservice if they skipped out on attending Saturday night's game. 
It'll be intense. 
It'll be gritty, hard-hitting hockey. 
Bragging right are on the line. 
Puck drops at Gila River Arena at 7 p.m. Read or Share this story: http://12ne.ws/1L8SwTR TOP VIDEOS
